00035 // Define XMLString::equals
00036 //#define XMLString::equals(a,b) XMLString::compareString(a,b) == 0
00037 class WFXMLStr : public XMLString {
00038   public:
00039    static bool equals (const XMLCh *const str1, const XMLCh *const str2) {
00040       return XMLString::compareString(str1,str2) == 0;
00041    }
00042    
00043    static bool equals (const char *const str1, const char *const str2) {
00044       return XMLString::compareString(str1,str2) == 0;
00045    }
00046 
00047    static bool equals (const XMLCh *const str1, const char *const str2) {
00048 #if 0
00049       // Version without alloc - tested a bit. Activate later.
00050       // Will it work for > 65535?
00051       // Will the other one work for > 128?
00052       const XMLCh* s1 = str1;
00053       mc2TextIterator s2(str2);
00054       for ( ;; ) {
00055          // Difference
00056          if ( *s1 != *s2 ) {
00057             return false;
00058          }
00059          // No differences so far and we're at the end
00060          if ( *s2 == 0 ) {
00061             return true;
00062          }
00063          ++s1;
00064          ++s2;
00065       }
00066 #else
00067       // Old version.
00068       XMLCh* s2 = XMLString::transcode( str2 );
00069       bool res = XMLString::compareString(str1,s2) == 0;
00070       delete [] s2;
00071       return res;
00072 #endif
00073    }
00074    
00075 };

00217 class XStr {
00218    public :
00219       template<class STRING> XStr( const STRING& str ) {
00220          m_str = XMLUtility::transcodetoucs( str );
00221       }
00222       
00223       ~XStr() {
00224          delete [] m_str;
00225       }
00226 
00227       const XMLCh* XMLStr() const {
00228          return m_str;
00229       }
00230 
00231    private:
00232       XMLCh* m_str;
00233 };
00234 
00240 class XTmpStr {
00241 public:
00242 
00244    XTmpStr( const char* str ) : m_str( strlen(str) + 1 ) {
00245       XMLUtility::transcodeToXML( m_str, str );
00246    }
00247 
00249    XTmpStr( const MC2String& str ) : m_str( str.length() + 1 ) {
00250       XMLUtility::transcodeToXML( m_str, str.c_str() );
00251    }
00252    
00254    operator const XMLCh*() const { return m_str; }
00255 private:
00257    StackOrHeap<256, XMLCh> m_str;
00258 };
00259 
00260 // This is cheaper than before, but it is still convenient.
00261 #define X(s) XTmpStr(s)
00262 
00267 template<class VALTYPE> class XMLNum {
00268 public:
00269    XMLNum( VALTYPE val, const char* format ) {
00270       // Print the string in ascii (0-9,a-f)
00271       char tmp[64];
00272       sprintf(tmp, format, val );
00273       // Convert ascii.
00274       XMLCh* dest = m_str;
00275       char* src = tmp;
00276       do {
00277          *dest++ = *src;
00278       } while ( *src++ != '\0' );
00279    }
00280 
00281    operator const XMLCh*() const {
00282       return m_str;
00283    }
00284 private:
00286    XMLCh m_str[64];   
00287 };
00288 
00289 #define XInt32(x)  (XMLNum<int32>(x,"%d"))
00290 #define XHex32(x)  (XMLNum<uint32>(x,"%x"))
00291 #define XUint32(x) (XMLNum<uint32>(x,"%u"))
00292 #define XInt64(x) (XMLNum<int64>(x,"%lld"))
00293 #define XHex64(x) (XMLNum<uint64>(x,"%llx"))
00294 #define XUint64(x) (XMLNum<uint64>(x,"%llu"))

00300 inline char* 
00301 XMLUtility::getChildTextValue( const DOMNode* cur ) {
00302    return NewStrDup::newStrDup( getChildTextStr( *cur ) ); 
00303 }
00304 
00305 inline XMLCh*
00306 XMLUtility::transcodetoucs( const MC2String& str ) {
00307    return transcodetoucs( str.c_str() );
00308 }
